Average True Range

Overview

Technical analysis indicator: Average True Range

How it works

The Average True Range measures market volatility by decomposing the entire range of an asset price for that period. Higher ATR values indicate higher volatility.

Parameters

  • period: Lookback period (default: 14)

Interpretation

Traders use the Average True Range to make informed decisions about entry and exit points.

Example Usage


// Example of using Average True Range in Rust
let result = indicators::atr(&data, 14);
